nodes.label: Leni Fitriani (2023-10-04)
nodes.detail: TOGAF-based Enterprise Architecture Framework for Utilizing Artificial Intelligence

metadata.author: Leni Fitriani, Masayu Leylia Khodra, Kridanto Surendro

nodes.label: Integrating AI is critical for organizational competitiveness in the digital tra...
nodes.detail: Integrating AI is critical for organizational competitiveness in the digital transformation era.

nodes.label: However, there are several challenges in implementing artificial intelligence in...
nodes.detail: However, there are several challenges in implementing artificial intelligence in enterprise architecture.

nodes.label: Current research on AI in enterprise architecture addresses only one or two ente...
nodes.detail: Current research on AI in enterprise architecture addresses only one or two enterprise architecture domains.

nodes.label: This research contributes to designing a comprehensive enterprise architectural ...
nodes.detail: This research contributes to designing a comprehensive enterprise architectural framework that utilizes artificial intelligence across all TOGAF domains.

nodes.label: The aim is to provide a guide that organizations can use in utilizing AI to acce...
nodes.detail: The aim is to provide a guide that organizations can use in utilizing AI to accelerate their digital transformation, increase efficiency, and achieve better business outcomes.

nodes.label: Enterprise architecture serves as a foundational discipline for managing complex...
nodes.detail: Enterprise architecture serves as a foundational discipline for managing complexity and guiding digital transformation initiatives across organizations.

nodes.label: TOGAF provides a comprehensive approach through the Architecture Development Met...
nodes.detail: TOGAF provides a comprehensive approach through the Architecture Development Method (ADM) that guides organizations through iterative cycles of architecture development.

nodes.label: Artificial intelligence has emerged as a transformative technology with the pote...
nodes.detail: Artificial intelligence has emerged as a transformative technology with the potential to fundamentally reshape how enterprises operate, make decisions, and deliver value.

nodes.label: The integration of AI into enterprise operations has become the key to increasin...
nodes.detail: The integration of AI into enterprise operations has become the key to increasing organizational competitiveness in the digital transformation era.

nodes.label: Despite the growing importance of AI, there is a significant gap in providing co...
nodes.detail: Despite the growing importance of AI, there is a significant gap in providing comprehensive architectural guidance for organizations pursuing AI-enabled digital transformation within established EA frameworks.

nodes.label: Existing research on AI in enterprise architecture tends to focus on only one or...
nodes.detail: Existing research on AI in enterprise architecture tends to focus on only one or two significant domains, such as the technology layer or the data layer, without addressing the full spectrum of EA domains.

nodes.label: Organizations require holistic guidance that spans all architectural domains — b...
nodes.detail: Organizations require holistic guidance that spans all architectural domains — business, data, application, and technology — to successfully integrate AI capabilities.

nodes.label: This paper proposes a TOGAF-based enterprise architectural framework that utiliz...
nodes.detail: This paper proposes a TOGAF-based enterprise architectural framework that utilizes AI across all significant EA domains to address this gap.

nodes.label: Enterprise architecture is a coherent whole of principles, methods, and models t...
nodes.detail: Enterprise architecture is a coherent whole of principles, methods, and models that are used in the design and realization of an enterprise's organizational structure, business processes, information systems, and infrastructure.

nodes.label: TOGAF is based on four interrelated areas of specialization called architecture ...
nodes.detail: TOGAF is based on four interrelated areas of specialization called architecture domains: business architecture, data architecture, application architecture, and technology architecture.

nodes.label: Business architecture defines the business strategy, governance, organization, a...
nodes.detail: Business architecture defines the business strategy, governance, organization, and key business processes of the organization.

nodes.label: Data architecture describes the structure of an organization's logical and physi...
nodes.detail: Data architecture describes the structure of an organization's logical and physical data assets and the associated data management resources.

nodes.label: Application architecture provides a blueprint for the individual application sys...
nodes.detail: Application architecture provides a blueprint for the individual application systems to be deployed, their interactions, and their relationships to the core business processes.

nodes.label: Technology architecture describes the logical software and hardware capabilities...
nodes.detail: Technology architecture describes the logical software and hardware capabilities required to support the deployment of business, data, and application services.

nodes.label: The TOGAF ADM (Architecture Development Method) provides a tested and repeatable...
nodes.detail: The TOGAF ADM (Architecture Development Method) provides a tested and repeatable process for developing architectures through a series of phases from preliminary through architecture change management.

nodes.label: Artificial intelligence encompasses a range of technologies including machine le...
nodes.detail: Artificial intelligence encompasses a range of technologies including machine learning, natural language processing, computer vision, and robotics that can automate complex tasks and augment human decision-making.

nodes.label: Cloud computing provides the scalable infrastructure necessary for training and ...
nodes.detail: Cloud computing provides the scalable infrastructure necessary for training and deploying AI models at enterprise scale.

nodes.label: IoT devices generate heterogeneous data streams that AI systems can process and ...
nodes.detail: IoT devices generate heterogeneous data streams that AI systems can process and analyze for real-time decision-making.

nodes.label: AI enhances enterprise security through automated threat detection, anomaly iden...
nodes.detail: AI enhances enterprise security through automated threat detection, anomaly identification, and predictive security analytics.

nodes.label: ERP systems can be enhanced with AI capabilities for intelligent business proces...
nodes.detail: ERP systems can be enhanced with AI capabilities for intelligent business process automation and predictive analytics.

nodes.label: Previous studies have explored the intersection of AI and enterprise architectur...
nodes.detail: Previous studies have explored the intersection of AI and enterprise architecture, but typically focus on narrow domains such as technology infrastructure or data management.

nodes.label: There is limited research that systematically maps AI capabilities onto all four...
nodes.detail: There is limited research that systematically maps AI capabilities onto all four TOGAF architecture domains simultaneously.

nodes.label: Some researchers have proposed intelligent enterprise architecture concepts, but...
nodes.detail: Some researchers have proposed intelligent enterprise architecture concepts, but these often lack alignment with established frameworks like TOGAF.

nodes.label: The gap in literature is the absence of a comprehensive, TOGAF-aligned framework...
nodes.detail: The gap in literature is the absence of a comprehensive, TOGAF-aligned framework that addresses AI integration across business, data, application, and technology domains.

nodes.label: The DSRM approach provides a structured process for creating and evaluating IT a...
nodes.detail: The DSRM approach provides a structured process for creating and evaluating IT artifacts intended to solve identified organizational problems.

nodes.label: The proposed framework adapts TOGAF by expanding its traditional architectural d...
nodes.detail: The proposed framework adapts TOGAF by expanding its traditional architectural domains to explicitly incorporate AI capabilities at each layer.

nodes.label: Rather than treating AI as a bolt-on technology, the framework establishes entry...
nodes.detail: Rather than treating AI as a bolt-on technology, the framework establishes entry points and applicability domains where AI can enhance enterprise operations.

nodes.label: The framework defines a core layer that integrates AI capabilities across all fo...
nodes.detail: The framework defines a core layer that integrates AI capabilities across all four TOGAF architecture domains: business, data, application, and technology.

nodes.label: In the business architecture domain, AI supports strategic decision-making, busi...
nodes.detail: In the business architecture domain, AI supports strategic decision-making, business process optimization, and organizational governance.

nodes.label: AI entry points in business architecture include automated business process anal...
nodes.detail: AI entry points in business architecture include automated business process analysis, intelligent strategy formulation support, and AI-driven governance mechanisms.

nodes.label: Business applications enhanced with AI can provide predictive analytics for mark...
nodes.detail: Business applications enhanced with AI can provide predictive analytics for market trends and customer behavior.

nodes.label: The data architecture domain is expanded to address heterogeneous data managemen...
nodes.detail: The data architecture domain is expanded to address heterogeneous data management requirements introduced by AI systems.

nodes.label: AI requires robust data pipelines that can handle structured, semi-structured, a...
nodes.detail: AI requires robust data pipelines that can handle structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from diverse sources including IoT sensors and enterprise systems.

nodes.label: Automatic model training and deployment pipelines are incorporated as data archi...
nodes.detail: Automatic model training and deployment pipelines are incorporated as data architecture components for managing the AI model lifecycle.

nodes.label: Data governance must be extended to address AI-specific concerns such as trainin...
nodes.detail: Data governance must be extended to address AI-specific concerns such as training data quality, bias detection, and model versioning.

nodes.label: Application architecture is extended to incorporate AI-powered business applicat...
nodes.detail: Application architecture is extended to incorporate AI-powered business applications and intelligent automation platforms.

nodes.label: AI integration in the application layer encompasses intelligent ERP modules, AI-...
nodes.detail: AI integration in the application layer encompasses intelligent ERP modules, AI-enhanced customer relationship management, and automated workflow systems.

nodes.label: The framework identifies entry points for embedding AI capabilities within exist...
nodes.detail: The framework identifies entry points for embedding AI capabilities within existing application portfolios rather than building standalone AI systems.

nodes.label: The technology architecture domain addresses the infrastructure requirements for...
nodes.detail: The technology architecture domain addresses the infrastructure requirements for deploying and operating AI systems at enterprise scale.

nodes.label: Cloud computing platforms provide the scalable compute, storage, and networking ...
nodes.detail: Cloud computing platforms provide the scalable compute, storage, and networking infrastructure essential for AI workloads.

nodes.label: IoT integration within the technology architecture enables real-time data collec...
nodes.detail: IoT integration within the technology architecture enables real-time data collection from edge devices for AI processing and analysis.

nodes.label: The security domain within technology architecture must be enhanced with AI-driv...
nodes.detail: The security domain within technology architecture must be enhanced with AI-driven security capabilities including automated threat detection and response.

nodes.label: The framework emphasizes that AI integration must be coordinated across all four...
nodes.detail: The framework emphasizes that AI integration must be coordinated across all four architecture domains to achieve maximum organizational benefit.

nodes.label: Cross-domain AI integration ensures that business strategy, data assets, applica...
nodes.detail: Cross-domain AI integration ensures that business strategy, data assets, applications, and technology infrastructure are aligned in support of AI-enabled digital transformation.

nodes.label: The proposed framework provides a mapping of AI entry points across domains, ide...
nodes.detail: The proposed framework provides a mapping of AI entry points across domains, identifying where AI capabilities can be most effectively introduced.

nodes.label: [Figure: Proposed TOGAF-based Enterprise Architecture Framework for AI] The fram...
nodes.detail: [Figure: Proposed TOGAF-based Enterprise Architecture Framework for AI] The framework diagram shows four TOGAF architecture domains (business, data, application, technology) arranged in layers, with AI entry points and applicability domains mapped across each layer. Supporting technology domains — cloud computing, IoT, security, and ERP — are shown as cross-cutting concerns that integrate with the AI capabilities at each architectural level. A core layer binds the AI capabilities together across all domains.

nodes.label: The proposed framework addresses the identified gap by providing comprehensive a...
nodes.detail: The proposed framework addresses the identified gap by providing comprehensive architectural guidance for AI integration across all four TOGAF domains.

nodes.label: Unlike previous approaches that focus on individual domains, this framework ensu...
nodes.detail: Unlike previous approaches that focus on individual domains, this framework ensures holistic consideration of how AI affects the entire enterprise architecture.

nodes.label: The framework is one of the first peer-reviewed academic works to systematically...
nodes.detail: The framework is one of the first peer-reviewed academic works to systematically map AI capabilities onto TOGAF domains.

nodes.label: By building on TOGAF rather than proposing an entirely new framework, the approa...
nodes.detail: By building on TOGAF rather than proposing an entirely new framework, the approach provides a bridge for organizations already using TOGAF to incorporate AI capabilities within their existing architectural practice.

nodes.label: The entry point concept allows organizations to identify specific, actionable lo...
nodes.detail: The entry point concept allows organizations to identify specific, actionable locations within their architecture where AI can be introduced incrementally.

nodes.label: Cloud computing, IoT, security, and ERP are identified as key supporting technol...
nodes.detail: Cloud computing, IoT, security, and ERP are identified as key supporting technology domains that enable AI integration across the enterprise architecture.

nodes.label: This research positions itself within the 'extend TOGAF' approach, arguing that ...
nodes.detail: This research positions itself within the 'extend TOGAF' approach, arguing that established frameworks can be adapted rather than abandoned.

nodes.label: The handling of heterogeneous data from multiple sources including IoT sensors r...
nodes.detail: The handling of heterogeneous data from multiple sources including IoT sensors represents a significant data architecture challenge that the framework addresses through expanded data governance.

nodes.label: Automatic model lifecycle management is identified as a critical capability that...
nodes.detail: Automatic model lifecycle management is identified as a critical capability that must be incorporated into the data and application architecture domains.

nodes.label: The framework provides organizations with comprehensive guidance for leveraging ...
nodes.detail: The framework provides organizations with comprehensive guidance for leveraging AI to accelerate digital transformation, increase efficiency, and achieve better business goals.

nodes.label: By identifying entry points and applicability domains for AI within each TOGAF d...
nodes.detail: By identifying entry points and applicability domains for AI within each TOGAF domain, the framework enables incremental and strategic AI adoption.

nodes.label: The framework addresses cloud computing, IoT, security, and ERP integration alon...
nodes.detail: The framework addresses cloud computing, IoT, security, and ERP integration alongside AI to provide a complete architectural picture.

nodes.label: Enterprise architecture facilitates seamless Gen AI adoption by aligning informa...
nodes.detail: Enterprise architecture facilitates seamless Gen AI adoption by aligning information systems, business processes, and technology frameworks.

nodes.detail: Integrating Gen AI into legacy systems represents a critical challenge for enterprises adopting generative AI capabilities.

nodes.detail: Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) supports real-time AI processing by enabling systems to react to events as they occur, facilitating responsive AI-powered workflows.

nodes.detail: EDA is particularly suited for AI use cases requiring real-time data processing and immediate action, such as fraud detection and anomaly monitoring.

nodes.detail: Microservices provide the composability and modularity needed for AI systems where individual models and components evolve at different rates.

nodes.detail: Governance frameworks must be established to ensure responsible and compliant deployment of Gen AI within the enterprise architecture.

nodes.detail: Continuous monitoring protocols are essential for maintaining the performance, reliability, and compliance of deployed Gen AI systems.

nodes.detail: Monitoring must cover model performance, data quality, system reliability, and compliance adherence on an ongoing basis post-deployment.

nodes.detail: Scaling strategies must account for infrastructure capacity, organizational change readiness, and the ability to maintain governance standards at increased deployment volumes.

nodes.detail: Successful scaling requires balancing speed of deployment with the need for robust governance, monitoring, and change management at each stage.

nodes.detail: Emerging AI regulations represent a key dimension that enterprises must incorporate into their Gen AI adoption frameworks.

nodes.label: The regulatory landscape for AI is evolving rapidly, and enterprise architecture...
nodes.detail: The regulatory landscape for AI is evolving rapidly, and enterprise architectures must be designed to accommodate compliance requirements as they emerge.

nodes.label: Industry collaborations between enterprises, technology vendors, and regulatory ...
nodes.detail: Industry collaborations between enterprises, technology vendors, and regulatory bodies will shape the trajectory of AI adoption standards and best practices.

nodes.detail: Technological advancements in AI capabilities will continue to expand the range of feasible enterprise use cases, requiring adaptive architectural approaches.

nodes.label: Forward-looking guidance for compliance helps enterprises prepare for regulatory...
nodes.detail: Forward-looking guidance for compliance helps enterprises prepare for regulatory requirements before they become mandatory.

nodes.detail: Enterprise architecture patterns enable operational efficiency gains by providing structured approaches to AI service deployment, integration, and management.

nodes.detail: SOA, EDA, and Microservices each provide viable patterns for enterprise AI integration, with the optimal choice depending on organizational context and use case requirements.

nodes.detail: The phased implementation approach — from use case identification through organizational readiness assessment, technology selection, pilot testing, and scaling — provides a practical roadmap for enterprise Gen AI adoption.

nodes.label: IT is a layered activity. We're losing the bottom layer, code generation. Tasks ...
nodes.detail: IT is a layered activity. We're losing the bottom layer, code generation. Tasks or roles continuously get pushed down into hardware or software, and humans get pushed up the ladder.

nodes.detail: It also means nonprogrammers are entering the IT function. Roles like product managers and UX designers are helping with coding because we're using AI to produce these shared artifacts.

nodes.label: There's a translation layer between the business and IT that we've never had bef...
nodes.detail: There's a translation layer between the business and IT that we've never had before. We're seeing small teams—maybe an engineer, a financial analyst, and a marketing person—create software.

nodes.detail: You can't trust everything to AI. Eventually, a human needs to look at it.

nodes.detail: It's like an old-school technical program manager who used to manage teams of engineers, but now you're managing fleets of AI agents.

nodes.label: But agents can't solve everything. They can work much faster than a human, but o...
nodes.detail: But agents can't solve everything. They can work much faster than a human, but our ambitions will get so much bigger.

nodes.label: All the projects that we ever wanted to do, we'll be able to do now, but it will...
nodes.detail: All the projects that we ever wanted to do, we'll be able to do now, but it will take this constant course-correcting and babysitting and shepherding AI.

nodes.label: As the AI tools get smarter, more nonprogrammers will be able to do this oversig...

nodes.label: But right now, it's all about programmers and their ability to be neuroplastic e...
nodes.detail: But right now, it's all about programmers and their ability to be neuroplastic enough to adapt to this entirely new way of working, where they're essentially directing AI.

nodes.label: That measure of productivity vanished almost overnight when chat-based coding to...
nodes.detail: That measure of productivity vanished almost overnight when chat-based coding tools came along, because now all you do is make a request in chat, the AI writes the code, and you copy and paste it.

nodes.label: It was harder to find good metrics because the improvements were more varied and...
nodes.detail: It was harder to find good metrics because the improvements were more varied and context-dependent than a simple acceptance rate.

nodes.label: Now we have coding agents, where the AI can use tools to run the code itself, se...
nodes.detail: Now we have coding agents, where the AI can use tools to run the code itself, see the results, and iterate without you having to manually copy-paste and relay information back and forth.

nodes.label: Then the discussion becomes what to do at performance review time when you're tr...

nodes.detail: They're standing in the way of having an army of brilliant junior programmers building the next-generation thing that could launch the company to the top of its category.

nodes.detail: People who are adaptable and neuroplastic have always been needed, but now they're more important than ever.

nodes.detail: Yet its practitioners are often thwarted by an overwhelming paradox: They must guide the evolution of vast, dynamic enterprises using tools and processes that are static, fragmented, and slow.

nodes.detail: Architects are stretched thin, trying to make sense of sprawling portfolios with limited visibility and time.

nodes.detail: "Data calls" are a weekly chore for both architects and stakeholders.

nodes.label: Architecture review boards — meant to ensure alignment — are seen as bureaucrati...
nodes.detail: Architecture review boards — meant to ensure alignment — are seen as bureaucratic bottlenecks.

nodes.detail: But what if the EA function was no longer confined to episodic review and disconnected models?

nodes.label: What if it operated in real time, continuously enriched by machine-readable data...
nodes.detail: What if it operated in real time, continuously enriched by machine-readable data and supported by intelligent agents that advise, validate, and even act?

nodes.label: This is not speculative fiction.
nodes.detail: This is not speculative fiction.

nodes.label: It is the emerging reality — a direct consequence of what we have called the sle...
nodes.detail: It is the emerging reality — a direct consequence of what we have called the sleeping giant waking up: the operationalization of architecture via closed feedback loops, AI agents, large language models (LLMs), retrieval-augmented generation, vector databases, and dynamic graph-based systems.

nodes.label: Traditional EA processes are largely open-loop.
nodes.detail: Traditional EA processes are largely open-loop.

nodes.label: A proposal is submitted, reviewed days or weeks later, deliberated in committee,...
nodes.detail: A proposal is submitted, reviewed days or weeks later, deliberated in committee, and eventually approved — often based on stale information.

nodes.label: By then, the initiative may have pivoted or the environment may have changed.
nodes.detail: By then, the initiative may have pivoted or the environment may have changed.

nodes.label: Now imagine a closed-loop learning architecture system: Every update from a cont...
nodes.detail: Now imagine a closed-loop learning architecture system: Every update from a continuous integration/continuous delivery pipeline, every change in a cloud API, every deviation from policy becomes a signal.

nodes.label: These signals are fed into a living architecture graph that reflects the true cu...
nodes.detail: These signals are fed into a living architecture graph that reflects the true current state of the enterprise.

nodes.label: Harvesting agents monitor the digital signals of the enterprise, extracting know...
nodes.detail: Harvesting agents monitor the digital signals of the enterprise, extracting knowledge into the information stores.

nodes.label: Dependency agents are a specialization of those, mapping the digital estate's in...
nodes.detail: Dependency agents are a specialization of those, mapping the digital estate's interconnections and analyzing both automated data such as traces as well as architectural and unstructured information that may provide essential insights into higher-order, logical dependencies that are very real yet are not readily discoverable at a technical level.

nodes.label: Lifecycle-aware agents flag aging technologies, enabling technical debt diagnosi...

nodes.detail: Security and cost agents trace implications across risk, compliance, and spend.

nodes.label: Architects are notified — not weeks after the fact but during or even before dec...
nodes.detail: Architects are notified — not weeks after the fact but during or even before decision points.

nodes.label: The result is a form of continuous architecture governance — high-velocity, high...
nodes.detail: The result is a form of continuous architecture governance — high-velocity, high-confidence, and fully traceable, supporting outcome-driven and valuable EA as never before.

nodes.label: AI augments the architect by continuously updating the repository to expose only...
nodes.detail: AI augments the architect by continuously updating the repository to expose only fresh data.

nodes.detail: That means no more digging through stale wikis or emailing 10 teams for basic system lifecycle info.

nodes.detail: Diagram recognition agents convert scanned or even hand-drawn schematics into structured model elements.

nodes.detail: Pattern recognition agents detect anti-patterns and optimization opportunities.

nodes.detail: Chatbots enable non-architects to interact with the repository, democratizing architecture insight.

nodes.detail: Generative agents propose transition roadmaps between current and target states based on actual feasibility, not just aspirational models.

nodes.label: This is not just automation — it's augmentation.
nodes.detail: This is not just automation — it's augmentation.

nodes.label: Architects remain in the loop, but the loop is smaller, faster, and smarter.
nodes.detail: Architects remain in the loop, but the loop is smaller, faster, and smarter.

nodes.detail: Real-time integration with operational sources (observability platforms, configuration systems, source control, deployment records) ensures that the architecture graph is never out of date.

nodes.label: Accenture (2023-06-04)
nodes.detail: 7 Architecture Considerations for Generative AI

nodes.label: Gen AI fundamentally changes enterprise architecture: instead of hundreds of pur...

nodes.label: Seven key architectural questions: (1) which foundation model, (2) how to access...
nodes.detail: Seven key architectural questions: (1) which foundation model, (2) how to access/deploy models, (3) how to adapt models to proprietary data, (4) overall enterprise readiness, (5) environmental impact, (6) how to industrialize Gen AI app development, (7) how to manage the entire Gen AI lifecycle.

nodes.label: Model access has two principal approaches: 'full control' (deploy on own infrast...
nodes.detail: Model access has two principal approaches: 'full control' (deploy on own infrastructure) vs. 'speed and simplicity' (managed cloud service).

nodes.detail: Data adaptation follows 'buy, build, or boost' — off-the-shelf with in-context learning, fine-tuning with own data, or building ground-up.

nodes.label: A modern data foundation as part of the enterprise digital core is a prerequisit...
nodes.detail: A modern data foundation as part of the enterprise digital core is a prerequisite for extracting value from Gen AI.

nodes.label: Enterprise readiness requires addressing security, reliability, responsibility, ...
nodes.detail: Enterprise readiness requires addressing security, reliability, responsibility, integration/interoperability, and trust — including Responsible AI governance.

nodes.detail: Environmental impact of AI must be considered upfront, especially for pre-training and fine-tuning at scale.

nodes.detail: Industrializing Gen AI requires new frameworks: vector databases, domain knowledge graphs, prompt management, and orchestration layers.

nodes.detail: Accenture's Chief AI Architect Atish Ray frames the core architectural shift: when pre-trained foundation models replace hundreds of purpose-built models, the emphasis shifts from data science to domain expertise, and the architecture must change accordingly.

nodes.label: Each consideration has distinct architectural implications.
nodes.detail: Each consideration has distinct architectural implications.

nodes.label: Enterprise readiness goes beyond technical requirements to encompass trust and R...
nodes.detail: Enterprise readiness goes beyond technical requirements to encompass trust and Responsible AI governance.

nodes.detail: The article argues that adopting Gen AI is an ideal time to review overall AI governance standards and operating models.

nodes.detail: The environmental consideration — often overlooked in enterprise architecture discussions — adds an important sustainability dimension.

nodes.detail: This article provides a practical, action-oriented framework for enterprise architects evaluating generative AI readiness.

nodes.detail: Consideration 1 — Which Foundation Model: Organizations must choose between pure-play AI vendors, open-source models, and hyperscaler-hosted models when selecting their foundation model.

nodes.label: Consideration 2 — How to Access/Deploy Models: The deployment approach ranges fr...
nodes.detail: Consideration 2 — How to Access/Deploy Models: The deployment approach ranges from 'full control' by deploying on own infrastructure to 'speed and simplicity' via managed cloud services.

nodes.label: Consideration 3 — How to Adapt Models to Proprietary Data: Data adaptation strat...
nodes.detail: Consideration 3 — How to Adapt Models to Proprietary Data: Data adaptation strategy follows 'buy, build, or boost' — using off-the-shelf models with in-context learning, fine-tuning with proprietary data, or building from the ground up.

nodes.label: Consideration 4 — Overall Enterprise Readiness: Enterprise readiness encompasses...
nodes.detail: Consideration 4 — Overall Enterprise Readiness: Enterprise readiness encompasses security, reliability, responsibility, integration/interoperability, and trust, including Responsible AI governance frameworks.

nodes.detail: Consideration 5 — Environmental Impact: The energy consumption of pre-training and fine-tuning foundation models at scale must be factored into architectural decisions.

nodes.detail: Consideration 6 — How to Industrialize Gen AI App Development: Industrializing Gen AI application development requires new architectural components including vector databases, domain knowledge graphs, prompt management systems, and orchestration layers.

nodes.label: Consideration 7 — How to Manage the Entire Gen AI Lifecycle: The full Gen AI lif...
nodes.detail: Consideration 7 — How to Manage the Entire Gen AI Lifecycle: The full Gen AI lifecycle requires governance over monitoring, versioning, and retraining of models.

nodes.label: For example, Kaiser Permanente, a US West Coast not-for-profit healthcare enterp...
nodes.detail: For example, Kaiser Permanente, a US West Coast not-for-profit healthcare enterprise with 12.5 million members, defined seven principles for assessing its responsible use of AI: privacy, reliability, high-quality and affordable outcomes, transparency, equity, customer prioritization, and trust.

nodes.label: These principles help Kaiser Permanente ensure that AI tools meet its standards.
nodes.detail: These principles help Kaiser Permanente ensure that AI tools meet its standards.

nodes.label: The second stage, representing 34 percent of enterprises in our research, is abo...
nodes.detail: The second stage, representing 34 percent of enterprises in our research, is about setting up AI pilots to demonstrate AI's ability to create value for both the enterprise and its people.

nodes.label: In this stage, enterprises define important metrics, begin to simplify and autom...
nodes.detail: In this stage, enterprises define important metrics, begin to simplify and automate business processes, and develop the enterprise capabilities they learned they need during the last stage.

nodes.label: Stage 2 enterprises focus on moving from experiments to systematic innovation by...
nodes.detail: Stage 2 enterprises focus on moving from experiments to systematic innovation by piloting use cases, tracking value created in the pilots, and storytelling both internally and externally about learnings from the pilots.

nodes.label: Fundamental to stage 2, the enterprise determines how to consolidate organizatio...
nodes.detail: Fundamental to stage 2, the enterprise determines how to consolidate organizational data silos and safely and securely serve the data for use with AI; this typically requires a significant investment in, or refinement of, APIs that link the data and the technologies.

nodes.label: In an AI pilot, the disability underwriting team at Guardian Life, a US mutual i...
nodes.detail: In an AI pilot, the disability underwriting team at Guardian Life, a US mutual insurance enterprise, is working with a partner to develop a generative AI tool that summarizes documentation and augments decision-making.

nodes.label: Participating underwriters are saving on average five hours per day, building on...
nodes.detail: Participating underwriters are saving on average five hours per day, building on Guardian's rich internal data and automated processes.

nodes.label: This pilot is helping Guardian to achieve its goal of reimagining end-to-end pro...
nodes.detail: This pilot is helping Guardian to achieve its goal of reimagining end-to-end process transformation.

nodes.label: Moving to stage 3 is a big step in the AI journey, both in terms of potential im...
nodes.detail: Moving to stage 3 is a big step in the AI journey, both in terms of potential impact on enterprise growth and profitability and the platform capabilities needed to achieve the scale required.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: Stage 3, which represented 31 percent of enterprises in our research, is focused...
nodes.detail: Stage 3, which represented 31 percent of enterprises in our research, is focused on industrializing AI throughout the enterprise.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: This includes building a scalable enterprise architecture (a platform for AI tha...
nodes.detail: This includes building a scalable enterprise architecture (a platform for AI that allows for scaling and reusing models), making data and outcomes transparent via business dashboards, developing a pervasive test-and-learn culture, and expanding business process automation efforts.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: Ally, the largest all-digital bank in the US, is scaling AI via its Ally.ai plat...
nodes.detail: Ally, the largest all-digital bank in the US, is scaling AI via its Ally.ai platform, which the enterprise launched in July 2023.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: The platform houses Ally AI tools that leverage technologies including natural l...
nodes.detail: The platform houses Ally AI tools that leverage technologies including natural language processing, machine learning, predictive analytics, and computer vision, and integrates several commercially available large language models with the enterprise's data in a safe environment.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: Early value from generative AI use cases includes saving an average three minute...
nodes.detail: Early value from generative AI use cases includes saving an average three minutes per customer call on more than four million customer calls in 2023 using call summarization.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: Ally developed creative campaigns 34 percent faster using a marketing generative...
nodes.detail: Ally developed creative campaigns 34 percent faster using a marketing generative AI chat feature.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: In stage 3 we see enterprises making significant use of foundation models, and s...
nodes.detail: In stage 3 we see enterprises making significant use of foundation models, and small language models (SLMs) that are trained on an industry, a function, or to perform specific tasks (such as onboarding a customer), to advance their journeys.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: Foundation models are a type of AI technology trained on vast amounts of data th...
nodes.detail: Foundation models are a type of AI technology trained on vast amounts of data that can be adapted to perform a wide variety of tasks.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working (footnote)

nodes.label: The models can be fine-tuned for specific domains or tasks by incorporating smal...
nodes.detail: The models can be fine-tuned for specific domains or tasks by incorporating smaller, specialized, curated datasets into the training set or by using software plug-ins or add-ons.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working (footnote)

nodes.label: Large language models (LLMs) are general-purpose foundation models.
nodes.detail: Large language models (LLMs) are general-purpose foundation models.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working (footnote)

nodes.label: Small language models (SLMs) are typically trained on smaller data sets tailored...
nodes.detail: Small language models (SLMs) are typically trained on smaller data sets tailored to specific industries, tasks, or domains and contain far fewer parameters.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working (footnote)

nodes.label: SLMs struggle when it comes to general knowledge and understanding but usually h...
nodes.detail: SLMs struggle when it comes to general knowledge and understanding but usually have less bias.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working (footnote)

nodes.label: They take these foundation models and SLMs and, on secure enterprise platforms, ...
nodes.detail: They take these foundation models and SLMs and, on secure enterprise platforms, apply them to their own data to create and capture new value.

metadata.section: Stage 3: Develop AI Ways of Working

nodes.label: In the fourth stage enterprises are what we call AI future ready, which represen...
nodes.detail: In the fourth stage enterprises are what we call AI future ready, which represented 7 percent of enterprises in our research.

nodes.label: AI is embedded in all decision-making in these enterprises.
nodes.detail: AI is embedded in all decision-making in these enterprises.

nodes.label: They leverage proprietary AI internally, and many sell new business services bas...
nodes.detail: They leverage proprietary AI internally, and many sell new business services based on that capability, the AI capability as a service, or both to other enterprises.

nodes.label: We define proprietary AI as the AI infrastructure developed in-house. For instan...
nodes.detail: We define proprietary AI as the AI infrastructure developed in-house. For instance, an AI platform developed in-house that integrates purchased large language models and enterprise assets such as APIs, data, and business processes is proprietary AI.

nodes.label: Ping An Insurance, one of the largest financial services enterprises in China, d...
nodes.detail: Ping An Insurance, one of the largest financial services enterprises in China, debuted an AI banking platform in 2019 and is now leveraging it.

nodes.label: By the end of 2022, 49 percent of Ping An's product sales were made by AI servic...
nodes.detail: By the end of 2022, 49 percent of Ping An's product sales were made by AI service representatives.

nodes.label: By the end of 2022, 82 percent of Ping An's service interactions were handled by...
nodes.detail: By the end of 2022, 82 percent of Ping An's service interactions were handled by AI representatives (i.e., AI software agents).

nodes.label: An AI or intelligent agent is a type of AI software that can understand and resp...
nodes.detail: An AI or intelligent agent is a type of AI software that can understand and respond to its environment without human intervention.

nodes.label: A smart thermostat is an example of an AI agent, as is a chatbot that can answer...
nodes.detail: A smart thermostat is an example of an AI agent, as is a chatbot that can answer questions, or a piece of software that can make decisions.

nodes.label: AI agents can adapt based on experience.
nodes.detail: AI agents can adapt based on experience.

nodes.label: Also by the end of 2022, AI representatives had saved RMB 600 million (approxima...
nodes.detail: Also by the end of 2022, AI representatives had saved RMB 600 million (approximately US$83 million) in labor costs for Ping An.

nodes.label: Ping An additionally provided AI banking as a service to thirty other Chinese ba...
nodes.detail: Ping An additionally provided AI banking as a service to thirty other Chinese banks.

nodes.label: In 2023, Ping An Group reported increased sales, reduced costs, improved efficie...
nodes.detail: In 2023, Ping An Group reported increased sales, reduced costs, improved efficiency, and reduced risks from using generative AI applications.

nodes.label: In our 2024 interviews as part of this research, an emerging theme was that inte...
nodes.detail: In our 2024 interviews as part of this research, an emerging theme was that interviewees expected the most value from AI will be created from combining people and platforms with a combination of four types of AI: analytical, generative, agentic and robotic.

nodes.label: We recommend that you bring a team together to talk about which of the four stag...
nodes.detail: We recommend that you bring a team together to talk about which of the four stages your enterprise is in today, and your aspirations and time frames regarding your enterprise's use of AI.

nodes.label: Then, discuss which enterprise capabilities and skill sets need more work.
nodes.detail: Then, discuss which enterprise capabilities and skill sets need more work.

nodes.label: No matter where you are in the MIT CISR Enterprise AI Maturity Model, be bold.
nodes.detail: No matter where you are in the MIT CISR Enterprise AI Maturity Model, be bold.

nodes.label: For example, Piyush Gupta, the CEO of DBS Bank, set a KPI of conducting one thou...
nodes.detail: For example, Piyush Gupta, the CEO of DBS Bank, set a KPI of conducting one thousand experiments per year.

nodes.label: DBS is building on that experimental mindset, coupled with a years-long investme...
nodes.detail: DBS is building on that experimental mindset, coupled with a years-long investment in a data foundation, to become an AI-fueled bank, with AI pervasive across the enterprise.

nodes.label: From 2022 to 2024, DBS Bank doubled the economic impact achieved from AI from S$...
nodes.detail: From 2022 to 2024, DBS Bank doubled the economic impact achieved from AI from S$150 million to S$370 million.

nodes.label: DBS has delivered over three hundred fifty AI use cases to date.
nodes.detail: DBS has delivered over three hundred fifty AI use cases to date.

nodes.label: DBS expects the economic impact of these AI use cases to exceed S$1 billion (app...
nodes.detail: DBS expects the economic impact of these AI use cases to exceed S$1 billion (approximately US$740 million) in 2025.
