nodes.label: Jim Rowan (2025-12-10)
nodes.detail: The Agentic Reality Check: Preparing for a Silicon-Based Workforce

metadata.author: Jim Rowan, Nitin Mittal, Parth Patwari, Ed Burns

nodes.label: Despite its promise, many agentic AI implementations are failing.
nodes.detail: Despite its promise, many agentic AI implementations are failing.

nodes.label: But leading organizations that are reimagining operations and managing agents as...
nodes.detail: But leading organizations that are reimagining operations and managing agents as workers are finding success.

nodes.label: They're trying to automate existing processes -- tasks designed by and for human...
nodes.detail: They're trying to automate existing processes -- tasks designed by and for human workers -- without reimagining how the work should actually be done.

nodes.label: Leading organizations are discovering something different: True value comes from...
nodes.detail: Leading organizations are discovering something different: True value comes from redesigning operations, not just layering agents onto old workflows.

nodes.label: This means building agent-compatible architectures, implementing robust orchestr...
nodes.detail: This means building agent-compatible architectures, implementing robust orchestration frameworks, and developing new management approaches for digital workers.

nodes.label: It also means rethinking work itself.
nodes.detail: It also means rethinking work itself.

nodes.label: As organizations embrace the full potential of agents, not only are their proces...
nodes.detail: As organizations embrace the full potential of agents, not only are their processes likely to change but so will their definition of a worker.

nodes.label: Agents may come to be seen as a silicon-based workforce that complements and enh...
nodes.detail: Agents may come to be seen as a silicon-based workforce that complements and enhances the human workforce.

nodes.label: Getting the fundamentals right -- from microservice-based agent architectures to...
nodes.detail: Getting the fundamentals right -- from microservice-based agent architectures to silicon-workforce management -- can prepare enterprises for whatever shape the future of workflow automation takes and position them to compete effectively in an agent-native business environment.

nodes.label: The momentum is undeniable: Gartner predicts that 15% of day-to-day work decisio...
nodes.detail: The momentum is undeniable: Gartner predicts that 15% of day-to-day work decisions will be made autonomously through agentic AI by 2028, up from none in 2024.

nodes.label: 33% of enterprise software applications will include agentic AI by 2028, compare...
nodes.detail: 33% of enterprise software applications will include agentic AI by 2028, compared with less than 1% today.

nodes.label: [Figure 1] Gartner predictions on agentic AI adoption: 15% of day-to-day work de...
nodes.detail: [Figure 1] Gartner predictions on agentic AI adoption: 15% of day-to-day work decisions autonomous by 2028 (from 0% in 2024); 33% of enterprise software applications will include agentic AI by 2028 (from less than 1% today).

nodes.label: Yet despite this enthusiasm, enterprises are encountering significant obstacles ...
nodes.detail: Yet despite this enthusiasm, enterprises are encountering significant obstacles in translating agentic pilots into production-ready solutions.

nodes.label: Deloitte's 2025 Emerging Technology Trends study notes that while 30% of surveye...
nodes.detail: Deloitte's 2025 Emerging Technology Trends study notes that while 30% of surveyed organizations are exploring agentic options and 38% are piloting solutions, only 14% have solutions that are ready to be deployed and a mere 11% are actively using these systems in production.

nodes.label: Furthermore, 42% of organizations report they are still developing their agentic...
nodes.detail: Furthermore, 42% of organizations report they are still developing their agentic strategy road map, with 35% having no formal strategy at all.

nodes.label: Legacy system integration: Traditional enterprise systems weren't designed for a...
nodes.detail: Legacy system integration: Traditional enterprise systems weren't designed for agentic interactions.

nodes.label: Most agents still rely on application programming interfaces (APIs) and conventi...
nodes.detail: Most agents still rely on application programming interfaces (APIs) and conventional data pipelines to access enterprise systems, which creates bottlenecks and limits their autonomous capabilities.

nodes.label: Gartner predicts that over 40% of agentic AI projects will fail by 2027 because ...
nodes.detail: Gartner predicts that over 40% of agentic AI projects will fail by 2027 because legacy systems can't support modern AI execution demands.

nodes.label: These systems lack the real-time execution capability, modern APIs, modular arch...
nodes.detail: These systems lack the real-time execution capability, modern APIs, modular architectures, and secure identity management needed for true agentic integration.

nodes.label: Data architecture constraints: Current enterprise data architectures, built arou...
nodes.detail: Data architecture constraints: Current enterprise data architectures, built around extract, transform, load (ETL) processes and data warehouses, create friction for agent deployment.

nodes.label: The fundamental issue is that most organizational data isn't positioned to be co...
nodes.detail: The fundamental issue is that most organizational data isn't positioned to be consumed by agents that need to understand business context and make decisions.

nodes.label: In a 2025 Deloitte survey, nearly half of organizations cited searchability of d...
nodes.detail: In a 2025 Deloitte survey, nearly half of organizations cited searchability of data (48%) and reusability of data (47%) as challenges to their AI automation strategy.

nodes.label: The solution involves a paradigm shift from traditional data pipelines to what c...
nodes.detail: The solution involves a paradigm shift from traditional data pipelines to what can be described as enterprise search and indexing -- similar to how Google made the World Wide Web discoverable.

nodes.label: This approach involves contextualizing enterprise data through content and index...
nodes.detail: This approach involves contextualizing enterprise data through content and index stores built on knowledge graphs, making information discoverable without requiring extensive ETL processes.

nodes.label: Governance and control frameworks: Enterprises struggle to establish appropriate...
nodes.detail: Governance and control frameworks: Enterprises struggle to establish appropriate oversight mechanisms for systems designed to operate autonomously.

nodes.label: Traditional IT governance models don't account for AI systems that make independ...
nodes.detail: Traditional IT governance models don't account for AI systems that make independent decisions and take actions.

nodes.label: The challenge extends beyond technical control to fundamental questions about pr...
nodes.detail: The challenge extends beyond technical control to fundamental questions about process redesign: Many organizations attempt to automate current processes rather than reimagine workflows for an agentic environment.

nodes.label: Additionally, many so-called agentic initiatives are actually automation use cas...
nodes.detail: Additionally, many so-called agentic initiatives are actually automation use cases in disguise.

nodes.label: Enterprises often apply agents where simpler tools would suffice, resulting in p...
nodes.detail: Enterprises often apply agents where simpler tools would suffice, resulting in poor ROI.

nodes.label: This 'agent washing' compounds the problem, with vendors rebranding existing aut...
nodes.detail: This 'agent washing' compounds the problem, with vendors rebranding existing automation capabilities as 'agents.'

nodes.label: Furthermore, poorly designed agentic applications can actually add work to a pro...
nodes.detail: Furthermore, poorly designed agentic applications can actually add work to a process, with some enterprises finding agentic 'workslop' can make processes even less efficient.

nodes.label: At their core, AI agents represent a new paradigm in how work gets done, but mos...
nodes.detail: At their core, AI agents represent a new paradigm in how work gets done, but most enterprises today simply aren't set up to take advantage of the opportunities for automation that agents present.

nodes.label: However, we're starting to see signs at leading organizations that these challen...
nodes.detail: However, we're starting to see signs at leading organizations that these challenges can be surmounted through strategic process redesign, architectural modernization, and new governance frameworks.

nodes.label: Forward-thinking organizations are moving beyond pilot projects to implement sys...
nodes.detail: Forward-thinking organizations are moving beyond pilot projects to implement systematic approaches for agentic transformation.

nodes.label: Their success stems from recognizing that effective agentic AI requires more tha...
nodes.detail: Their success stems from recognizing that effective agentic AI requires more than deploying individual agents.

nodes.label: Instead, it requires thoughtful approaches to integrating agents into systems an...
nodes.detail: Instead, it requires thoughtful approaches to integrating agents into systems and workflows, and carefully managing agents once they're rolled out.

nodes.label: Leading enterprises don't simply layer agents onto existing workflows.
nodes.detail: Leading enterprises don't simply layer agents onto existing workflows.

nodes.label: Instead, they redesign processes to leverage the unique strengths of agents.
nodes.detail: Instead, they redesign processes to leverage the unique strengths of agents.

nodes.label: This requires taking a step back and examining end-to-end processes rather than ...
nodes.detail: This requires taking a step back and examining end-to-end processes rather than finding automation opportunities within current operations.

nodes.label: Agents can handle a range of transactions, communicate with each other, and coll...
nodes.detail: Agents can handle a range of transactions, communicate with each other, and collaborate to achieve a business outcome, but only when the underlying processes are structured to support these capabilities.

nodes.label: 'Don't simply pave the cow path. Instead, take advantage of this AI evolution to...
nodes.detail: 'Don't simply pave the cow path. Instead, take advantage of this AI evolution to reimagine how agents can best collaborate, support, and optimize operations for the business.'

nodes.label: Most businesses' existing processes were designed around human staff.
nodes.detail: Most businesses' existing processes were designed around human staff.

nodes.label: When organizations realize this, the opportunities for process redesign become c...
nodes.detail: When organizations realize this, the opportunities for process redesign become compelling.

nodes.label: That's why enterprises that are succeeding with agentic AI are looking at their ...
nodes.detail: That's why enterprises that are succeeding with agentic AI are looking at their processes from end to end.

nodes.label: Enterprise software and services company HPE is developing an AI agent with exac...
nodes.detail: Enterprise software and services company HPE is developing an AI agent with exactly this kind of process redesign in mind.

nodes.label: Her team led the creation of an AI agent called Alfred that helps complete inter...
nodes.detail: Her team led the creation of an AI agent called Alfred that helps complete internal operational performance reviews.

nodes.label: Myers says the process of conducting the review is very time-consuming, but it's...
nodes.detail: Myers says the process of conducting the review is very time-consuming, but it's also developed from large data sets, making it ripe for agentic automation.

nodes.label: The agent developed by the team consists of an agentic front-end user interface ...
nodes.detail: The agent developed by the team consists of an agentic front-end user interface that works with four separate underlying agents.

nodes.label: These agents break down queries into multiple elements for processing, conduct d...
nodes.detail: These agents break down queries into multiple elements for processing, conduct data analysis on SQL data, build charts and graphs to present data, and translate AI insights into user-friendly structured reports.

nodes.label: The agents pull data from the company's data warehouse, which sits on top of its...
nodes.detail: The agents pull data from the company's data warehouse, which sits on top of its enterprise resourcing planning and customer relationship management systems.

nodes.label: If we think of agents as digital skills, their real value emerges when they star...
nodes.detail: If we think of agents as digital skills, their real value emerges when they start operating as a collective.

nodes.label: First-generation AI tools, like chatbots and coding assistants, are very good at...
nodes.detail: First-generation AI tools, like chatbots and coding assistants, are very good at dealing with single-dimensional processes, like presenting sales information or writing code.

nodes.label: But the minute you get into a process that's composite -- that doesn't wholly ex...
nodes.detail: But the minute you get into a process that's composite -- that doesn't wholly exist within a single domain -- agents are the better tool.

nodes.label: Agents have the ability to pass context between each other, to reason across bou...
nodes.detail: Agents have the ability to pass context between each other, to reason across boundaries, and to interact over protocols like agent-to-agent.

nodes.label: Most composite processes don't exist solely within the enterprise.
nodes.detail: Most composite processes don't exist solely within the enterprise.

nodes.label: Trustworthy, secure interworking between agents is critical.
nodes.detail: Trustworthy, secure interworking between agents is critical.

nodes.label: Otherwise, we can never digitize those processes across boundaries.
nodes.detail: Otherwise, we can never digitize those processes across boundaries.

nodes.label: Most enterprises have barely tapped into applying AI to monolithic singular proc...
nodes.detail: Most enterprises have barely tapped into applying AI to monolithic singular processes.

nodes.label: Imagine the productivity if you apply AI to the composite processes that run you...
nodes.detail: Imagine the productivity if you apply AI to the composite processes that run your organization.

nodes.label: We now have a dozen agentic proofs of concept, all going after composite problem...
nodes.detail: We now have a dozen agentic proofs of concept, all going after composite problems like quoting or end-to-end remediation of a customer issue across domains, including entitlements, billing, and logistics.

nodes.label: We have agentic technology emerging across sales, services, supply chain, and en...
nodes.detail: We have agentic technology emerging across sales, services, supply chain, and engineering, areas that have a material impact on the company's financial performance.

nodes.label: We've probably tapped into 20 digitized enterprise processes.
nodes.detail: We've probably tapped into 20 digitized enterprise processes.

nodes.label: Before the end of 2025, we will have live autonomous systems that are more than ...
nodes.detail: Before the end of 2025, we will have live autonomous systems that are more than likely working across domains as first-generation tools.

nodes.label: That discipline has kept experiments as experiments, and production only happens...
nodes.detail: That discipline has kept experiments as experiments, and production only happens if there is solid ROI.

nodes.label: We also realized that you apply AI to processes, not to people, organizations, o...
nodes.detail: We also realized that you apply AI to processes, not to people, organizations, or companies.

nodes.label: We expect you to be very clear about the processes you're improving.
nodes.detail: We expect you to be very clear about the processes you're improving.

nodes.label: As a result, we stopped allowing people to design their own AI solutions, and in...
nodes.detail: As a result, we stopped allowing people to design their own AI solutions, and instead, we created an architectural review board that evaluates and approves AI investments and solutions.

nodes.label: AI is a process improvement technology, so if you don't have solid processes, yo...
nodes.detail: AI is a process improvement technology, so if you don't have solid processes, you should not proceed.

nodes.label: Figure that out first, because otherwise, you'll be guessing where to apply this...
nodes.detail: Figure that out first, because otherwise, you'll be guessing where to apply this technology.

nodes.label: We cleaned up our data and gained clarity on the processes we have in place.
nodes.detail: We cleaned up our data and gained clarity on the processes we have in place.

nodes.label: Without that, we would have been trying to apply AI to something that wasn't qua...
nodes.detail: Without that, we would have been trying to apply AI to something that wasn't quantifiable and might not be accurate.

nodes.label: With this approach in mind, our services organization has digitized every proces...
nodes.detail: With this approach in mind, our services organization has digitized every process.

nodes.label: We brought all their data together into a single assistant that sits in every di...
nodes.detail: We brought all their data together into a single assistant that sits in every digital and human channel to predict the next best action.

nodes.label: The result has been double-digit improvements on every metric around cost and cu...
nodes.detail: The result has been double-digit improvements on every metric around cost and customer satisfaction.

nodes.label: When an organization examines its end-to-end processes, it will likely discover ...
nodes.detail: When an organization examines its end-to-end processes, it will likely discover workflows that span multiple systems, including legacy software.

nodes.label: AI is increasingly able to learn and understand the essential business rules and...
nodes.detail: AI is increasingly able to learn and understand the essential business rules and workflows that define a business' operations.

nodes.label: Organizations should carefully consider what constitutes their true core systems...
nodes.detail: Organizations should carefully consider what constitutes their true core systems and determine whether to use traditional application modernization when agents can effectively bridge legacy system gaps.

nodes.label: At Toyota, teams are using an agentic tool to gain better visibility into the es...
nodes.detail: At Toyota, teams are using an agentic tool to gain better visibility into the estimated time of arrival of vehicles at dealerships and will soon start using agents to resolve supply issues.

nodes.label: The process used to involve 50 to 100 mainframe screens and significant hands-on...
nodes.detail: The process used to involve 50 to 100 mainframe screens and significant hands-on work from supply chain team members.

nodes.label: Now, an agent delivers real-time information to staff on vehicles from pre-manuf...
nodes.detail: Now, an agent delivers real-time information to staff on vehicles from pre-manufacturing through delivery to the dealership, all without anyone having to interact with the mainframe.

nodes.label: Going forward, the team plans to empower agents to identify delays in vehicle sh...
nodes.detail: Going forward, the team plans to empower agents to identify delays in vehicle shipments and draft emails to try to resolve the issue.

nodes.label: Perhaps the most significant shift when implementing AI agents involves recogniz...
nodes.detail: Perhaps the most significant shift when implementing AI agents involves recognizing that agents represent a new form of labor, one that may share some similarities with the human (or carbon-based) workforce.

nodes.label: Some organizations are beginning to think beyond using agents as simple automati...
nodes.detail: Some organizations are beginning to think beyond using agents as simple automation tools and are starting to explore ways to integrate them with their human workforce.

nodes.label: This evolution represents a fundamental reimagining of what work means, how it's...
nodes.detail: This evolution represents a fundamental reimagining of what work means, how it's performed, and who performs it.

nodes.label: At the heart of this shift is a recognition that AI agents and human workers hav...
nodes.detail: At the heart of this shift is a recognition that AI agents and human workers have different skill sets.

nodes.label: While agents excel at defined processes, humans remain essential for navigating ...
nodes.detail: While agents excel at defined processes, humans remain essential for navigating the shifting ground of business requirements and complex problem-solving scenarios.

nodes.label: Compliance and governance: Humans increasingly focus on validation, oversight, a...
nodes.detail: Compliance and governance: Humans increasingly focus on validation, oversight, and building guardrails for agent operations.

nodes.label: Growth and innovation: They also concentrate on reimagining operations and ident...
nodes.detail: Growth and innovation: They also concentrate on reimagining operations and identifying new opportunities that emerge from agent capabilities.

nodes.label: At insurance company Mapfre, AI agents are used across the organization, includi...
nodes.detail: At insurance company Mapfre, AI agents are used across the organization, including in claims management, where agents handle routine administrative tasks like damage assessments.

nodes.label: And when it comes to more sensitive tasks like customer communication, a person ...
nodes.detail: And when it comes to more sensitive tasks like customer communication, a person is always in the loop.

nodes.label: Maribel Solanas Gonzalez, Mapfre's group chief data officer, says she carefully ...
nodes.detail: Maribel Solanas Gonzalez, Mapfre's group chief data officer, says she carefully considers which tasks to delegate to agents, ensuring that they are tasks that agents can complete safely and efficiently.

nodes.label: Anything that may carry risk still goes through a human worker.
nodes.detail: Anything that may carry risk still goes through a human worker.

nodes.label: This is beginning to change the nature of jobs.
nodes.detail: This is beginning to change the nature of jobs.

nodes.label: The company has published an AI manifesto that prioritizes well-governed, respec...
nodes.detail: The company has published an AI manifesto that prioritizes well-governed, respectful, and safe AI.

nodes.label: Biotech company Moderna recently named its first chief people and digital techno...
nodes.detail: Biotech company Moderna recently named its first chief people and digital technology officer, essentially combining its technology and HR functions.

nodes.label: The move was a strategic step to evolve Moderna's operating model by integrating...
nodes.detail: The move was a strategic step to evolve Moderna's operating model by integrating people and technology to accelerate how work gets done.

nodes.label: Successful deployments focus on specific, well-defined domains rather than attem...
nodes.detail: Successful deployments focus on specific, well-defined domains rather than attempting enterprise-wide automation.

nodes.label: Broad automation remains possible but requires multiple specialized agents worki...
nodes.detail: Broad automation remains possible but requires multiple specialized agents working in an orchestrated fashion rather than single, monolithic solutions.

nodes.label: Organizations face critical build-versus-buy decisions that often depend on tech...
nodes.detail: Organizations face critical build-versus-buy decisions that often depend on technical maturity and specific use case requirements.

nodes.label: Research indicates that pilots built through strategic partnerships are twice as...
nodes.detail: Research indicates that pilots built through strategic partnerships are twice as likely to reach full deployment compared to those built internally, with employee usage rates nearly double for externally built tools.

nodes.label: The first wave of generative AI in the enterprise consisted largely of general-p...
nodes.detail: The first wave of generative AI in the enterprise consisted largely of general-purpose chatbots, which, while useful as productivity tools, often don't deliver the kind of opportunities to automate that businesses need to drive new efficiencies.

nodes.label: With AI agents, organizations can develop highly specialized tools that automati...
nodes.detail: With AI agents, organizations can develop highly specialized tools that automatically execute specific tasks.

nodes.label: When these specialists are deployed in an orchestrated manner, they can automate...
nodes.detail: When these specialists are deployed in an orchestrated manner, they can automate entire workflows.

nodes.label: Model Context Protocol (MCP): Developed by Anthropic, MCP standardizes how AI sy...
nodes.detail: Model Context Protocol (MCP): Developed by Anthropic, MCP standardizes how AI systems connect to data sources and tools, providing a universal interface for agents to access enterprise resources.

nodes.label: While promising, MCP faces limitations in handling complex enterprise security r...
nodes.detail: While promising, MCP faces limitations in handling complex enterprise security requirements and integrating legacy systems.

nodes.label: Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A): Google's protocol enables direct communication be...
nodes.detail: Agent-to-Agent Protocol (A2A): Google's protocol enables direct communication between different AI agents across platforms, handling agent discovery, task delegation, and collaborative workflow.

nodes.label: Agent Communication Protocol (ACP): This is an open protocol that enables agents...
nodes.detail: Agent Communication Protocol (ACP): This is an open protocol that enables agents to communicate with each other through a RESTful API, allowing agents to collaborate regardless of the environment in which they were built.

nodes.label: ACP may face hurdles due to limitations on the number of agents that can coordin...
nodes.detail: ACP may face hurdles due to limitations on the number of agents that can coordinate in a single network and the complexity of integrating with existing enterprise tools.

nodes.label: These protocols represent the foundational layer for what experts describe as a ...
nodes.detail: These protocols represent the foundational layer for what experts describe as a 'microservices approach to AI': deploying numerous smaller, specialized agents across various platforms closer to where workflow instructions and data reside.

nodes.label: This approach offers several advantages, such as reduced complexity (because sma...
nodes.detail: This approach offers several advantages, such as reduced complexity (because smaller agents are easier to debug, test, and maintain); scalable orchestration, where multiple specialized agents can be combined for complex tasks; and platform flexibility that allows agents to run on different systems while maintaining interoperability.

nodes.label: As agents operate continuously, poorly configured agent interactions can trigger...
nodes.detail: As agents operate continuously, poorly configured agent interactions can trigger cascading actions like unpredictable resource consumption and ballooning costs, making cost management critical.

nodes.label: Organizations need specialized financial operations frameworks (or FinOps) to mo...
nodes.detail: Organizations need specialized financial operations frameworks (or FinOps) to monitor and control agent-driven expenses and account for token-based pricing models.

nodes.label: These frameworks help track costs in detail through resource tagging, real-time ...
nodes.detail: These frameworks help track costs in detail through resource tagging, real-time monitoring, automated resource management including autoscaling and rightsizing, and strong governance frameworks to manage AI-specific expenditures.

nodes.label: What agents will be deployed, and what functions will they perform?
nodes.detail: What agents will be deployed, and what functions will they perform?

nodes.label: What are the cost profiles relative to human employees?
nodes.detail: What are the cost profiles relative to human employees?

nodes.label: Which processes will be automated and at what level of efficiency?
nodes.detail: Which processes will be automated and at what level of efficiency?

nodes.label: What will be the optimal mix of human and digital workforce over the next four y...
nodes.detail: What will be the optimal mix of human and digital workforce over the next four years?

nodes.label: Will agents eventually take over entire operational areas beyond the five-year h...
nodes.detail: Will agents eventually take over entire operational areas beyond the five-year horizon?

nodes.label: Most enterprises ready to implement AI agents today are likely to have prepared ...
nodes.detail: Most enterprises ready to implement AI agents today are likely to have prepared answers for the first three questions.

nodes.label: However, things get hazier as they consider the latter two.
nodes.detail: However, things get hazier as they consider the latter two.

nodes.label: The future enterprise is likely to experience significant changes in the fundame...
nodes.detail: The future enterprise is likely to experience significant changes in the fundamental nature of work, extending beyond traditional carbon-based workforces to include digital agents that autonomously handle entire job functions.

nodes.label: If organizations get this balance right, it may become the primary competitive d...
nodes.detail: If organizations get this balance right, it may become the primary competitive differentiator in most industries going forward.

nodes.label: Organizations should define clear boundaries for agent decision-making through g...
nodes.detail: Organizations should define clear boundaries for agent decision-making through graduated autonomy levels, with appropriate human oversight triggers.

nodes.label: Augmentation: Today's reality where agents enhance human worker capabilities.
nodes.detail: Augmentation: Today's reality where agents enhance human worker capabilities.

nodes.label: Automation: An emerging capability where agents automate tasks within processes ...
nodes.detail: Automation: An emerging capability where agents automate tasks within processes defined by humans.

nodes.label: True autonomy: A future state in which artificial general intelligence enables a...
nodes.detail: True autonomy: A future state in which artificial general intelligence enables agents to work with minimal oversight.

nodes.label: Success requires deploying 'agent supervisors' -- humans who enter workflows at ...
nodes.detail: Success requires deploying 'agent supervisors' -- humans who enter workflows at intentionally designed points to handle exceptions requiring their judgment.

nodes.label: This isn't simply about checking agents' work, but about strategic handoffs of w...
nodes.detail: This isn't simply about checking agents' work, but about strategic handoffs of work at critical decision points.

nodes.label: Over the coming years, as AI technology improves, potentially to the point of re...
nodes.detail: Over the coming years, as AI technology improves, potentially to the point of reaching artificial general intelligence, organizations should be able to let agents work more independently.

nodes.label: Leaders should continually assess the state of AI capabilities to ensure they ar...
nodes.detail: Leaders should continually assess the state of AI capabilities to ensure they are delegating responsibilities that agents are suited to handle.

nodes.label: As agents mature within job functions, organizations will need equally mature ap...
nodes.detail: As agents mature within job functions, organizations will need equally mature approaches to managing them.

nodes.label: This will likely require an entirely new framework for managing agents that not ...
nodes.detail: This will likely require an entirely new framework for managing agents that not only leans on traditional human resource management concepts for areas where agents share similarities with human workers, but also diverges to account for their unique characteristics.

nodes.label: Some areas of focus for HR, such as workplace culture, employee loyalty, and wor...
nodes.detail: Some areas of focus for HR, such as workplace culture, employee loyalty, and worker motivation, won't be applicable to agents but will remain key pillars of how organizations manage their human staff.

nodes.label: Other features of worker management can be extended to apply to agents, even if ...
nodes.detail: Other features of worker management can be extended to apply to agents, even if they look slightly different.

nodes.label: Onboarding: Just as with human workers, agents will require onboarding processes...
nodes.detail: Onboarding: Just as with human workers, agents will require onboarding processes that train them in the enterprise's unique data and operations.

nodes.label: At the same time, the human supervisor of the agent should receive training and ...
nodes.detail: At the same time, the human supervisor of the agent should receive training and education on how to leverage the new agents.

nodes.label: This will require a new two-pronged approach to onboarding digital labor that pr...
nodes.detail: This will require a new two-pronged approach to onboarding digital labor that prepares both the agent and the human staff for collaboration.

nodes.label: Performance management: This may be one of the areas where managing agents diver...
nodes.detail: Performance management: This may be one of the areas where managing agents diverges most from traditional human resource management.

nodes.label: Organizations will need systems to prove what agents did, why they made specific...
nodes.detail: Organizations will need systems to prove what agents did, why they made specific decisions, and under whose authority they acted.

nodes.label: This requires digital identity systems, cryptographic receipts for transactions,...
nodes.detail: This requires digital identity systems, cryptographic receipts for transactions, and immutable logs for every agent action.

nodes.label: As agents roll out across businesses' operations, they will create too much data...
nodes.detail: As agents roll out across businesses' operations, they will create too much data for human managers to evaluate, which may drive a need for additional agents that manage performance.

nodes.label: Life cycle management: Agents will require ongoing training updates, redeploymen...
nodes.detail: Life cycle management: Agents will require ongoing training updates, redeployment to priority areas, and potentially even retirement planning.

nodes.label: Organizations are beginning to assign individual names to agents to track produc...
nodes.detail: Organizations are beginning to assign individual names to agents to track productivity contributions, recognizing that digital workers may eventually be subject to taxation similar to human employees.

nodes.label: Zero trust architecture: Implementing ephemeral authentication systems ensures t...
nodes.detail: Zero trust architecture: Implementing ephemeral authentication systems ensures that agent actions are continuously verified and authorized, just as human workers must periodically complete authentication tasks to access enterprise resources.

nodes.label: When calibrated properly, the framework for managing agents will drive strong co...
nodes.detail: When calibrated properly, the framework for managing agents will drive strong collaboration between human and digital workers.

nodes.label: However, taking the analogy of agents as digital workers too literally may limit...
nodes.detail: However, taking the analogy of agents as digital workers too literally may limit the potential of agents.

nodes.label: Holding them to standards developed for measuring human performance risks misali...
nodes.detail: Holding them to standards developed for measuring human performance risks misaligning their activities to functions better left to human workers.

nodes.label: In an agent-driven environment, systems generate vast amounts of data describing...
nodes.detail: In an agent-driven environment, systems generate vast amounts of data describing actions taken and outcomes.

nodes.label: Today, most agents do not train on their own output data, but in the future, thi...
nodes.detail: Today, most agents do not train on their own output data, but in the future, this digital exhaust of silicon workers can become a valuable trove of insights that allow agents to learn and improve.

nodes.label: Going forward, the key differentiation lies in how organizations channel this by...
nodes.detail: Going forward, the key differentiation lies in how organizations channel this byproduct to reinforce agent learning and capabilities.

nodes.label: This represents a fundamental mindset shift.
nodes.detail: This represents a fundamental mindset shift.

nodes.label: Every act of inference by agents generates tokens, and those tokens constitute d...
nodes.detail: Every act of inference by agents generates tokens, and those tokens constitute data that can reinforce learning systems.

nodes.label: What is likely to matter most in the future is the sophisticated use of this con...
nodes.detail: What is likely to matter most in the future is the sophisticated use of this continuous data stream.

nodes.label: Examining the future of system modernization, early evidence suggests that a hyb...
nodes.detail: Examining the future of system modernization, early evidence suggests that a hybrid approach is most likely to prevail, where agents extend the useful life of legacy systems, while organizations pursue the selective modernization of critical business processes.

nodes.label: This approach allows organizations to realize immediate value from agentic capab...
nodes.detail: This approach allows organizations to realize immediate value from agentic capabilities while maintaining strategic flexibility for future technology decisions.

nodes.label: The transition to agentic AI represents more than technological evolution -- it'...
nodes.detail: The transition to agentic AI represents more than technological evolution -- it's an organizational transformation that is likely to reshape how enterprises operate, compete, and create value.

nodes.label: Organizations that master the foundational elements of agent-native process desi...
nodes.detail: Organizations that master the foundational elements of agent-native process design, multiagent orchestration, and silicon workforce management will be positioned to thrive in an increasingly automated business environment.

nodes.label: The key to success lies in recognizing that agentic transformation is not about ...
nodes.detail: The key to success lies in recognizing that agentic transformation is not about replacing humans with machines, but about creating new forms of human-AI collaboration that leverage the unique strengths of both human and silicon-based workers.

nodes.label: The organizations that figure out how to drive this collaboration effectively wi...
nodes.detail: The organizations that figure out how to drive this collaboration effectively will define the future of work itself.

nodes.label: Leaders in many organizations aren't clear on what this means.
nodes.detail: Leaders in many organizations aren't clear on what this means.

nodes.label: There tends to be a lot of hand-waving and statements like 'AI will do stuff' or...
nodes.detail: There tends to be a lot of hand-waving and statements like 'AI will do stuff' or 'you'll manage a bunch of agents.'

nodes.label: But that doesn't happen without rethinking and redoing the way organizations ope...
nodes.detail: But that doesn't happen without rethinking and redoing the way organizations operate.

nodes.label: I find it's not actually a technology problem. It's a process problem.
nodes.detail: I find it's not actually a technology problem. It's a process problem.

nodes.label: It means you have to understand the jagged frontier.
nodes.detail: It means you have to understand the jagged frontier.

nodes.label: AI has gotten very good at math and coding, which has an obvious impact on math ...
nodes.detail: AI has gotten very good at math and coding, which has an obvious impact on math and coding tasks, but also a less apparent impact on tasks like analysis or meeting with people.

nodes.label: Workers will have to adjust their time in their jobs to do different things.
nodes.detail: Workers will have to adjust their time in their jobs to do different things.

nodes.label: It's not that AI agents do everything; they do the basic grunt work, so I can ca...
nodes.detail: It's not that AI agents do everything; they do the basic grunt work, so I can call more organizations to interview them instead.

nodes.label: Leaders have to be able to articulate that future.
nodes.detail: Leaders have to be able to articulate that future.

nodes.label: You need three things to do AI work: leadership, lab, and crowd.
nodes.detail: You need three things to do AI work: leadership, lab, and crowd.

nodes.label: First, you need the crowd: everyone in the organization using these systems.
nodes.detail: First, you need the crowd: everyone in the organization using these systems.

nodes.label: Second, you need the lab, which is actively doing 24/7 experimentation, taking i...
nodes.detail: Second, you need the lab, which is actively doing 24/7 experimentation, taking ideas from the crowd, and turning them into real products.

nodes.label: And finally, you need aligned leadership.
nodes.detail: And finally, you need aligned leadership.

nodes.label: Leaders have to think about organizational design.
nodes.detail: Leaders have to think about organizational design.

nodes.label: For example, if you can code 10 times or 100 times faster than you did before, a...
nodes.detail: For example, if you can code 10 times or 100 times faster than you did before, are you still doing Agile development? Agile doesn't work at that speed, so you don't need to be doing it.

nodes.label: There's a 'using AI' skill that we don't exactly know how to measure or train fo...
nodes.detail: There's a 'using AI' skill that we don't exactly know how to measure or train for yet.

nodes.label: It probably involves agency and willingness to experiment, being incentivized pr...
nodes.detail: It probably involves agency and willingness to experiment, being incentivized properly, and being a subject matter expert in your field.

nodes.label: I don't know, but agents are already better than people think.
nodes.detail: I don't know, but agents are already better than people think.

nodes.label: True agents are already here. You're just not using them. And you have to build ...
nodes.detail: True agents are already here. You're just not using them. And you have to build them. But it's doable today.

nodes.label: There's no future timeframe.
nodes.detail: There's no future timeframe.

nodes.label: Because you absolutely can build economically valuable agents right now with cur...
nodes.detail: Because you absolutely can build economically valuable agents right now with current technology, and companies are building agentic workflows that do a lot of work autonomously at high accuracy levels.

nodes.label: Do they replace all work yet? No, nor do I want them to.
nodes.detail: Do they replace all work yet? No, nor do I want them to.

nodes.label: But if you're waiting until the technology is more mature, you're going to be in...
nodes.detail: But if you're waiting until the technology is more mature, you're going to be in trouble because it's already there.

nodes.label: John M. Willis (2026-02-11)
nodes.detail: The PBSAI Governance Ecosystem: A Multi-Agent AI Reference Architecture for Securing Enterprise AI Estates

nodes.label: These systems increasingly function not as isolated models but as AI estates: so...
nodes.detail: These systems increasingly function not as isolated models but as AI estates: socio technical systems spanning models, agents, data pipelines, security tooling, human workflows, and hyperscale infrastructure.

nodes.label: Existing governance and security frameworks, including the NIST AI Risk Manageme...
nodes.detail: Existing governance and security frameworks, including the NIST AI Risk Management Framework and systems security engineering guidance, articulate principles and risk functions but do not provide implementable architectures for multi agent, AI enabled cyber defense.

nodes.label: PBSAI organizes responsibilities into a twelve domain taxonomy and defines bound...
nodes.detail: PBSAI organizes responsibilities into a twelve domain taxonomy and defines bounded agent families that mediate between tools and policy through shared context envelopes and structured output contracts.

nodes.detail: The architecture assumes baseline enterprise security capabilities and encodes key systems security techniques, including analytic monitoring, coordinated defense, and adaptive response.

nodes.detail: We demonstrate alignment with NIST AI RMF functions and illustrate application in enterprise SOC and hyperscale defensive environments.

nodes.label: PBSAI is proposed as a structured, evidence centric foundation for open ecosyste...
nodes.detail: PBSAI is proposed as a structured, evidence centric foundation for open ecosystem development and future empirical validation.

nodes.label: Introduces the Practitioners Blueprint for Secure AI (PBSAI) Governance Ecosyste...
nodes.detail: Introduces the Practitioners Blueprint for Secure AI (PBSAI) Governance Ecosystem -- a multi-agent reference architecture specifically for securing enterprise AI estates.

nodes.label: Defines a twelve-domain taxonomy for organizing AI governance responsibilities a...
nodes.detail: Defines a twelve-domain taxonomy for organizing AI governance responsibilities across the enterprise.

nodes.label: Uses bounded agent families that mediate between tools and policy through shared...
nodes.detail: Uses bounded agent families that mediate between tools and policy through shared context envelopes and structured output contracts.

nodes.label: Demonstrates explicit alignment with NIST AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF) ...
nodes.detail: Demonstrates explicit alignment with NIST AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF) functions.

nodes.label: Addresses the gap that existing governance and security frameworks (including NI...
nodes.detail: Addresses the gap that existing governance and security frameworks (including NIST AI RMF and systems security engineering guidance) do not provide implementable architectures for multi-agent, AI-enabled cyber defense.

nodes.label: 43 pages plus 12 pages of appendices -- a comprehensive treatment.
nodes.detail: 43 pages plus 12 pages of appendices -- a comprehensive treatment.

nodes.label: The PBSAI Governance Ecosystem paper addresses a critical gap in enterprise AI: ...
nodes.detail: The PBSAI Governance Ecosystem paper addresses a critical gap in enterprise AI: while frameworks like the NIST AI RMF provide governance principles, they do not offer implementable architectures for multi-agent, AI-enabled environments.

nodes.label: The paper proposes a reference architecture that organizes governance responsibi...
nodes.detail: The paper proposes a reference architecture that organizes governance responsibilities into a twelve-domain taxonomy and defines bounded agent families that mediate between security tools and organizational policy.

nodes.label: The architecture treats enterprise AI deployments as 'AI estates' -- socio-techn...
nodes.detail: The architecture treats enterprise AI deployments as 'AI estates' -- socio-technical systems spanning models, agents, data pipelines, security tooling, human workflows, and hyperscale infrastructure.

nodes.label: PBSAI assumes baseline enterprise security capabilities and encodes key systems ...
nodes.detail: PBSAI assumes baseline enterprise security capabilities and encodes key systems security techniques including analytic monitoring, coordinated defense, and adaptive response.

nodes.label: A distinctive feature is the use of shared context envelopes and structured outp...
nodes.detail: A distinctive feature is the use of shared context envelopes and structured output contracts between agent families, providing a formal mechanism for maintaining traceability, provenance, and human-in-the-loop guarantees across domains.

nodes.label: The paper demonstrates practical application in enterprise Security Operations C...
nodes.detail: The paper demonstrates practical application in enterprise Security Operations Center (SOC) and hyperscale defensive environments, showing how the architecture maps to NIST AI RMF functions.

nodes.label: This makes it one of the few academic works that bridges the gap between high-le...
nodes.detail: This makes it one of the few academic works that bridges the gap between high-level AI governance frameworks and concrete, implementable enterprise architectures.

nodes.label: Enterprises are rapidly deploying large language models, retrieval augmented gen...
nodes.detail: Enterprises are rapidly deploying large language models, retrieval augmented generation pipelines, and tool-using agents into production on shared high-performance computing clusters, and these systems function as AI estates: socio-technical systems spanning models, agents, data pipelines, security tooling, human workflows, and hyperscale infrastructure.

nodes.label: Existing governance and security frameworks, including the NIST AI Risk Manageme...
nodes.detail: Existing governance and security frameworks, including the NIST AI Risk Management Framework and systems security engineering guidance, do not provide implementable architectures for multi-agent, AI-enabled cyber defense.

nodes.label: This paper provides one of the most detailed and rigorous reference architecture...
nodes.detail: This paper provides one of the most detailed and rigorous reference architectures for AI governance at the enterprise level.

nodes.label: The twelve-domain taxonomy and bounded agent family model offer a concrete archi...
nodes.detail: The twelve-domain taxonomy and bounded agent family model offer a concrete architectural pattern for organizations trying to operationalize AI governance.

nodes.detail: Context envelopes serve as a shared communication mechanism between agent families, carrying provenance, traceability, and policy context.

nodes.label: Structured output contracts define the formal interface between agent families, ...
nodes.detail: Structured output contracts define the formal interface between agent families, ensuring consistent and verifiable outputs.

nodes.detail: The architecture provides ecosystem-level invariants that guarantee traceability across all governance domains.

nodes.detail: The architecture provides ecosystem-level invariants that guarantee provenance tracking across all governance domains.

nodes.detail: The architecture provides ecosystem-level invariants that guarantee human-in-the-loop oversight across all governance domains.

nodes.detail: PBSAI encodes analytic monitoring as a key systems security technique for AI estates.

nodes.label: CIO.com (2025-11-01)
nodes.detail: The Enterprise IT Overhaul: Architecting Your Stack for the Agentic AI Era

nodes.label: The fundamental architectural shift for agentic AI is moving from synchronous, t...
nodes.detail: The fundamental architectural shift for agentic AI is moving from synchronous, tightly coupled connections to event-driven architecture (EDA).

nodes.label: An event-driven architecture built on message brokers like Apache Kafka decouple...
nodes.detail: An event-driven architecture built on message brokers like Apache Kafka decouples agents from each other and from core enterprise systems.

nodes.label: The data streaming and messaging backbone becomes the primary agent orchestratio...
nodes.detail: The data streaming and messaging backbone becomes the primary agent orchestration layer, requiring investment to handle semantic complexity and volume of agent-to-agent communication.

nodes.label: Organizations need to create an 'agent tier' in their enterprise architecture co...
nodes.detail: Organizations need to create an 'agent tier' in their enterprise architecture comprising cognitive AI for reasoning capabilities and autonomous orchestration systems.

nodes.label: Traditional REST API calls to monolithic systems (ERP, CRM) create bottlenecks f...
nodes.detail: Traditional REST API calls to monolithic systems (ERP, CRM) create bottlenecks for autonomous agents.

nodes.label: If 2025 was about the brain (the LLM), 2026 must be about the nervous system.
nodes.detail: If 2025 was about the brain (the LLM), 2026 must be about the nervous system.

nodes.label: The central argument is that agentic AI -- autonomous systems capable of reasoni...
nodes.detail: The central argument is that agentic AI -- autonomous systems capable of reasoning, planning, and executing multi-step tasks across the enterprise -- requires a fundamental rethinking of enterprise architecture, not incremental API additions.

nodes.label: The article identifies event-driven architecture as the foundational shift requi...
nodes.detail: The article identifies event-driven architecture as the foundational shift required.

nodes.label: Traditional synchronous, tightly coupled integration patterns (typical REST API ...
nodes.detail: Traditional synchronous, tightly coupled integration patterns (typical REST API calls to monolithic ERP and CRM systems) create bottlenecks when agents need to operate autonomously.

nodes.label: Instead, organizations should adopt asynchronous, event-driven architectures whe...
nodes.detail: Instead, organizations should adopt asynchronous, event-driven architectures where agents interact with a message bus (like Apache Kafka or Amazon EventBridge) rather than making direct, blocking calls to legacy databases.

nodes.label: This allows for long-running tasks where agents can trigger actions and resume w...
nodes.detail: This allows for long-running tasks where agents can trigger actions and resume when events are published back.

nodes.label: A key architectural concept introduced is the 'agent tier' -- a new layer in the...
nodes.detail: A key architectural concept introduced is the 'agent tier' -- a new layer in the enterprise architecture comprising cognitive AI for reasoning capabilities and autonomous orchestration systems that trigger appropriate applications.

nodes.label: This represents a significant evolution of traditional enterprise architecture l...
nodes.detail: This represents a significant evolution of traditional enterprise architecture layering models, adding an intelligent orchestration layer between business processes and underlying systems.

nodes.label: If 2025 was about the brain (the LLM), 2026 must be about the nervous system.
nodes.detail: If 2025 was about the brain (the LLM), 2026 must be about the nervous system.

nodes.label: The traditional approach to integrating new tools -- a simple REST API call to a...
nodes.detail: The traditional approach to integrating new tools -- a simple REST API call to a monolithic system like your ERP or CRM -- is a bottleneck for autonomous agents.

nodes.label: An event-driven architecture, typically built on a message broker like Kafka, de...
nodes.detail: An event-driven architecture, typically built on a message broker like Kafka, decouples agents from one another and from your core systems.

nodes.detail: The concept of an 'agent tier' as a new enterprise architecture layer directly extends traditional EA layering models (like TOGAF's architecture domains).

nodes.detail: The emphasis on event-driven architecture as a prerequisite for agentic AI deployment offers a specific technical pattern that enterprise architects can adopt.

nodes.detail: The 'brain vs. nervous system' framing effectively communicates that AI infrastructure is as important as AI models themselves.

nodes.label: Mervin Rasiah (2025-01-30)
nodes.detail: How Enterprise Architecture Enables AI Sovereignty -- With Governance at the Core

nodes.label: As AI becomes woven into day-to-day business, AI sovereignty -- retaining contro...
nodes.detail: As AI becomes woven into day-to-day business, AI sovereignty -- retaining control over your data, models, and decision rights -- moves from an IT concern to a board-level priority.

nodes.label: Enterprise Architecture (EA) is the function that turns high-level principles in...
nodes.detail: Enterprise Architecture (EA) is the function that turns high-level principles into deployable designs, enforceable controls, and auditable evidence -- so your organization can innovate with AI without losing control of its institutional intelligence.

nodes.label: Research and conference summaries have highlighted EA's evolving role as the ent...
nodes.detail: Research and conference summaries have highlighted EA's evolving role as the enterprise's 'decision architecture,' integrating strategy, data, platforms, risks, and controls.

nodes.label: AI sovereignty is your organization's ability to decide, design, and demonstrate...
nodes.detail: AI sovereignty is your organization's ability to decide, design, and demonstrate where and how sensitive data and model intelligence are stored, processed, accessed, and reused -- by you, not by external platforms.

nodes.label: In practice, it answers: Where is our data? Who can use it, for what purpose, wi...
nodes.detail: In practice, it answers: Where is our data? Who can use it, for what purpose, with which keys, and under whose jurisdiction?

nodes.label: Those answers must be provable in audits and resilient to regulatory change.
nodes.detail: Those answers must be provable in audits and resilient to regulatory change.

nodes.label: In Malaysia, SIRIM has launched ISO/IEC 42001 certification pathways, giving ent...
nodes.detail: In Malaysia, SIRIM has launched ISO/IEC 42001 certification pathways, giving enterprises a locally recognized route to demonstrate responsible AI management.

nodes.label: Why use both: NIST helps you do risk management; ISO/IEC 42001 helps you prove y...
nodes.detail: Why use both: NIST helps you do risk management; ISO/IEC 42001 helps you prove you do it systematically -- a combination that aligns well with regulators and scales across use cases.

nodes.label: At the same time, Malaysia is developing a National AI Regulatory Framework and ...
nodes.detail: At the same time, Malaysia is developing a National AI Regulatory Framework and has signaled the possibility of legislation by 2H 2026, so organizations should build adaptable governance that can meet today's voluntary guidance yet scale to future legal obligations.

metadata.section: Malaysia: Govern Now, Adapt for What's Coming

nodes.label: The AI Technology Action Plan 2026-2030 aims to reinforce ethical AI governance ...
nodes.detail: The AI Technology Action Plan 2026-2030 aims to reinforce ethical AI governance and strengthen cross-sector collaboration -- another reason to favor open, evidence-based frameworks (NIST + ISO/IEC 42001) that can absorb new requirements without re-architecting your control model.

metadata.section: Malaysia: Govern Now, Adapt for What's Coming

nodes.label: Pragmatic tip for Malaysia: If you want assurance while the law is finalized, pu...
nodes.detail: Pragmatic tip for Malaysia: If you want assurance while the law is finalized, pursue ISO/IEC 42001 certification via SIRIM to build audit muscle now, and map NIST AI RMF controls to your EA repository so evidence is searchable on demand.

nodes.detail: Modern governance leaders emphasize metadata-driven control.

nodes.detail: Column-Level Lineage & Purpose Binding -- Bind data to intended purpose (analytics vs training vs inference) and deny reuse outside purpose.

nodes.detail: Residency Patterns & Landing Zones -- Standardize placements (e.g., in-region public cloud with boundary controls, hybrid/on-prem for high-control scenarios, SaaS with no training/retention and in-region processing).

nodes.label: Cloud providers now publish sovereignty controls, which you should codify as pol...
nodes.detail: Cloud providers now publish sovereignty controls, which you should codify as policy-as-code and architecture standards.

nodes.label: Access & Key Management -- Enforce least privilege via centralized identity; use...
nodes.detail: Access & Key Management -- Enforce least privilege via centralized identity; use customer-managed, HSM-backed keys; log all key operations and access as evidence.

nodes.label: Model I/O Guardrails -- Treat prompts, embeddings, and outputs as governed data;...
nodes.detail: Model I/O Guardrails -- Treat prompts, embeddings, and outputs as governed data; apply DLP/PII policies and log flows; align to NIST risk actions and AIGE privacy/accountability principles.

nodes.label: Evidence by Design -- Capture machine-readable evidence (who, what, where, which...
nodes.detail: Evidence by Design -- Capture machine-readable evidence (who, what, where, which keys/tests) to satisfy ISO/IEC 42001 audits and NIST outcomes.

nodes.label: Inventory AI systems (including embedded AI in SaaS), data stores, cross-border ...
nodes.detail: Inventory AI systems (including embedded AI in SaaS), data stores, cross-border flows, and existing controls; record in Alfabet; align to NIST 'MAP' evidence.

nodes.label: Publish sovereignty patterns (public/sovereign cloud, hybrid, disconnected) and ...
nodes.detail: Publish sovereignty patterns (public/sovereign cloud, hybrid, disconnected) and key-custody standards; implement policy-as-code in cloud and represent as Technology Standards in Alfabet.

nodes.label: Enforce risk-tiered approvals; require lineage/DQ, privacy/bias testing, and sig...
nodes.detail: Enforce risk-tiered approvals; require lineage/DQ, privacy/bias testing, and sign-offs; store evidence against Model and Release objects; integrate with your ModelOps stack.

nodes.label: Dashboard NIST/ISO control coverage, AIGE alignment, incidents, and recertificat...
nodes.detail: Dashboard NIST/ISO control coverage, AIGE alignment, incidents, and recertification cadence; run red-team exercises; update controls as Malaysia's framework lands (and as ISO guidance evolves).

nodes.label: AI sovereignty isn't a single product or policy -- it's an EA-led operating mode...
nodes.detail: AI sovereignty isn't a single product or policy -- it's an EA-led operating model grounded in open frameworks (NIST AI RMF + ISO/IEC 42001), executed via a trusted EA repository like Bizzdesign Alfabet, and adaptable to national contexts such as Malaysia's AIGE today and its forthcoming AI regulations.

nodes.label: That's how you innovate at speed while keeping company-specific data and institu...
nodes.detail: That's how you innovate at speed while keeping company-specific data and institutional intelligence firmly under your control.

nodes.label: McKinsey Digital (2024-12-02)
nodes.detail: Enterprise Technology's Next Chapter: Four Gen AI Shifts That Will Reshape Business Technology

nodes.label: Four emerging gen AI shifts will reshape how tech leaders organize teams, manage...
nodes.detail: Four emerging gen AI shifts will reshape how tech leaders organize teams, manage talent, design IT architecture, and handle costs over the next decade.

nodes.label: IT architectures will evolve from a traditional application-focused approach to ...
nodes.detail: IT architectures will evolve from a traditional application-focused approach to multiagent architectures where tech leaders oversee hundreds or thousands of distinct gen AI agents that communicate with one another and the outside world.

nodes.label: The 'factory and artisan' pattern distinguishes between standardized, repeatable...
nodes.detail: The 'factory and artisan' pattern distinguishes between standardized, repeatable AI workflows (factory) and creative, high-judgment work (artisan) — tech leaders must balance both.

nodes.label: Modular frameworks for developing common reusable gen AI agents and tools are es...
nodes.detail: Modular frameworks for developing common reusable gen AI agents and tools are essential — agents should be assembled 'like LEGOs' for different agentic workflows.

nodes.label: A fleet of gen AI agents can interact with existing inventory, supply chain, and...
nodes.detail: A fleet of gen AI agents can interact with existing inventory, supply chain, and analytics systems to automatically monitor stock levels, identify low inventory, and generate purchase orders without complex integrations.

nodes.label: Full adoption of this new enterprise technology operating model is likely a deca...
nodes.detail: Full adoption of this new enterprise technology operating model is likely a decade away.

nodes.label: Success requires more than tooling — it hinges on understanding where to impleme...
nodes.detail: Success requires more than tooling — it hinges on understanding where to implement factory vs. artisan patterns, designing effective agent architecture, and preparing for implications on talent, cost, operations, and risk.

nodes.label: The article argues that gen AI is not merely an incremental improvement but will...
nodes.detail: The article argues that gen AI is not merely an incremental improvement but will fundamentally restructure how technology organizations operate, from team composition and talent management to IT architecture and cost structures.

nodes.label: The most architecturally significant shift is the move from traditional applicat...
nodes.detail: The most architecturally significant shift is the move from traditional application-centric IT architectures to multiagent architectures.

nodes.label: In this new paradigm, tech leaders will oversee potentially hundreds or thousand...
nodes.detail: In this new paradigm, tech leaders will oversee potentially hundreds or thousands of distinct gen AI agents that communicate with each other and external systems to achieve common goals.

nodes.label: McKinsey illustrates this with the example of agent fleets that interact across ...
nodes.detail: McKinsey illustrates this with the example of agent fleets that interact across inventory, supply chain, and analytics systems to autonomously manage stock levels and purchasing — tasks that previously required complex system integrations.

nodes.label: Factory patterns apply to standardized, repeatable AI workflows that can be scal...
nodes.detail: Factory patterns apply to standardized, repeatable AI workflows that can be scaled and optimized for cost-efficiency.

nodes.label: Artisan patterns apply to creative, high-judgment work that requires human exper...
nodes.detail: Artisan patterns apply to creative, high-judgment work that requires human expertise augmented by AI.

nodes.label: The key leadership challenge is regularly reviewing and fine-tuning the balance ...
nodes.detail: The key leadership challenge is regularly reviewing and fine-tuning the balance between these patterns, including identifying opportunities for autonomous agents within workflows and ways to increase artisan team productivity.

nodes.label: The article tempers expectations by noting that full adoption is likely a decade...
nodes.detail: The article tempers expectations by noting that full adoption is likely a decade away, emphasizing that success requires strategic design, not just technology deployment.

nodes.label: IT architectures are expected to be significantly different, evolving from a tra...
nodes.detail: IT architectures are expected to be significantly different, evolving from a traditional application-focused approach to new multiagent architectures where tech leaders oversee hundreds or thousands of distinct gen AI agents.

nodes.label: Modular frameworks that guide the development of common reusable gen AI agents a...
nodes.detail: Modular frameworks that guide the development of common reusable gen AI agents and tools are important to ensure agents can be easily modified and assembled, like LEGOs, for use in different agentic workflows.

nodes.label: The multiagent architecture vision represents a fundamental departure from tradi...
nodes.detail: The multiagent architecture vision represents a fundamental departure from traditional application-centric enterprise architecture.

nodes.label: The 'factory and artisan' framework provides a practical classification system t...
nodes.detail: The 'factory and artisan' framework provides a practical classification system that enterprise architects can use to plan their AI architecture strategy.

nodes.label: The decade-long timeline for full adoption is an important counterbalance to hyp...
nodes.detail: The decade-long timeline for full adoption is an important counterbalance to hype, suggesting that EA for AI is a sustained transformation journey, not a quick technology deployment.

nodes.label: Jeanne Ross and Cynthi... (2020-08-24)
nodes.detail: Why You — Yes, You — Need Enterprise Architecture

nodes.label: Enterprise architecture is defined as 'the holistic design of people, processes,...
nodes.detail: Enterprise architecture is defined as 'the holistic design of people, processes, and technology to execute digitally inspired strategic goals.'

nodes.label: Three principles for organizational redesign through EA: (1) break key outcomes ...
nodes.detail: Three principles for organizational redesign through EA: (1) break key outcomes into components with designated accountability, (2) empower cross-functional teams, (3) allow business design to influence strategy.

nodes.label: Componentization — decomposing a business into reusable people-process-technolog...
nodes.detail: Componentization — decomposing a business into reusable people-process-technology bundles — is the foundation of modern EA.

nodes.label: Each component becomes a 'living asset' with a team that continually improves pr...
nodes.detail: Each component becomes a 'living asset' with a team that continually improves processes and technologies in response to changing needs.

nodes.label: Strategy becomes both top-down and bottom-up: leaders create teams to seize oppo...
nodes.detail: Strategy becomes both top-down and bottom-up: leaders create teams to seize opportunities while component teams reformulate strategy based on continuous learning.

nodes.label: CarMax evolved from 3 initial product teams (~2015) to 30+ empowered teams with ...
nodes.detail: CarMax evolved from 3 initial product teams (~2015) to 30+ empowered teams with accountability for specified components of an omnichannel business model.

nodes.label: Traditional management separates IT (systems), functional leaders (processes), a...
nodes.detail: Traditional management separates IT (systems), functional leaders (processes), and business managers (people) — EA integrates these into unified component teams.

nodes.label: When companies fund teams rather than strategic initiatives or systems developme...
nodes.detail: When companies fund teams rather than strategic initiatives or systems development projects, they can respond almost instantaneously to emerging opportunities.

nodes.label: MIT Sloan Management Review authors Jeanne Ross and Cynthia Beath make the case ...
nodes.detail: MIT Sloan Management Review authors Jeanne Ross and Cynthia Beath make the case that enterprise architecture is essential for any organization seeking to compete in the digital economy.

nodes.label: They define EA broadly as the holistic design of people, processes, and technolo...
nodes.detail: They define EA broadly as the holistic design of people, processes, and technology — not just IT systems — to execute digitally inspired strategic goals.

nodes.label: Every negative customer interaction via app, website, phone, or service provider...
nodes.detail: Every negative customer interaction via app, website, phone, or service provider 'exposes your architectural inadequacies.'

nodes.label: First, componentization: breaking key business outcomes (products, customer expe...
nodes.detail: First, componentization: breaking key business outcomes (products, customer experiences, core processes) into reusable components with clear accountability, where each component is a living asset continuously improved by a dedicated team.

nodes.label: Second, empowerment: cross-functional teams (product owners, developers, user de...
nodes.detail: Second, empowerment: cross-functional teams (product owners, developers, user designers, data scientists, legal, finance) are given autonomy to define and meet their goals.

nodes.label: Third, strategy influence: as component teams address strategic objectives, they...
nodes.detail: Third, strategy influence: as component teams address strategic objectives, they simultaneously reformulate strategy based on continuous learning about customer needs and technology capabilities.

nodes.label: The CarMax case study illustrates the evolutionary approach: starting with three...
nodes.detail: The CarMax case study illustrates the evolutionary approach: starting with three product teams in 2015 to address urgent online experience needs, then gradually expanding to 30+ empowered teams covering the full omnichannel business model.

nodes.label: This demonstrates that EA transformation is incremental and value-generating at ...
nodes.detail: This demonstrates that EA transformation is incremental and value-generating at each step, not a big-bang redesign.

nodes.label: We define enterprise architecture as the holistic design of people, processes, a...
nodes.detail: We define enterprise architecture as the holistic design of people, processes, and technology to execute digitally inspired strategic goals.

nodes.label: Every negative customer interaction via a company app, website, telephone call, ...
nodes.detail: Every negative customer interaction via a company app, website, telephone call, or service provider exposes your architectural inadequacies.

nodes.label: When companies fund teams rather than strategic initiatives or systems developme...
nodes.detail: When companies fund teams rather than strategic initiatives or systems development projects, those groups can respond almost instantaneously to what Spotify refers to as the company's 'bets.'

nodes.label: The definition of EA as encompassing people, processes, and technology — not jus...
nodes.detail: The definition of EA as encompassing people, processes, and technology — not just IT systems — is particularly relevant as AI transforms all three dimensions simultaneously.

nodes.label: The componentization principle directly maps to the modular, composable architec...
nodes.detail: The componentization principle directly maps to the modular, composable architectures that AI implementations require.

nodes.label: The cross-functional team model anticipates the human-AI collaboration patterns ...
nodes.detail: The cross-functional team model anticipates the human-AI collaboration patterns emerging in AI-native organizations.

nodes.label: Understanding these EA fundamentals is necessary to appreciate how profoundly AI...
nodes.detail: Understanding these EA fundamentals is necessary to appreciate how profoundly AI is reshaping the discipline.

nodes.detail: By 2028, AI agent ecosystems will enable networks of specialized agents to dynamically collaborate across multiple applications and multiple business functions, allowing users to achieve goals without interacting with each application individually.

nodes.label: GenAI is reimagining entire business processes and value chains, not merely automating existing workflows -- it is a catalyst for process redesign.

nodes.detail: Composable, modular architectures are essential for AI systems because AI components evolve at different rates, and rigid architectures become obsolete within months.
